text: With 1.0 raw ledger, will the queries be tracked and stored or just all proposed transactions?

Queries that are run during endorser simulation execution, which are not ultimately submitted as transactions, will not be logged to the raw ledger.  Only submitted transactions are written to the raw ledger.
Thanks Dave. QQ on v0.6 - is there any semblance of the historical database? If I wanted to find all historical changes to a JSON-based asset in 0.6 can I do that
Not easily, you would have to essentially walk through the chain and re-execute all the trans.
A simple way to see history of an asset is a high priority requirement for v1
Is there an example of how you could do it in 0.6 that I can access?
Got a customer interested in demonstrating the ‘immutable provenance’ aspect of blockchain on our app
Unfortunately I don’t have much experience with 0.5/0.6 myself… I expect more people with 0.6 knowledge would be watching the ‘fabric’ channel if you want to post there.

<@U0PV6MUD6> -  there is really no way to do this within v0.6 /0.5.  The only way you could do this would be entirely external to chaincode.   If you cleverly structured your chaincode function calls such that the asset id was always somehow passed in as a parameter (or even the full JSON was passed in as a parameter), you could read all the blocks and parse them to build this out of band.  Of course this is kinda crappy because we can only query 1 block at a time.  The other option would be to build this history in near real-time (again outside) but building an event listener and building the history from those events
Interesting approach. Glad we have this capability in 1.0, but looks like we won’t have time to construct this in my project.
@alliblackwell you asked for the playback recording with couchdb- you can find it here:  <https://youtu.be/aEv4_Lm2N2k>
